title: Trump evacuated from rally stage in Pennsylvania after shooting
summary: The former US president gave his first account of being shot at a rally in Butler on Saturday, saying 'I was shot with a bullet that pierced the upper part of my right ear.' A local prosecutor says the suspected gunman and at least one attendee are dead.

title: Joe Biden's presidential campaign, a slow-motion train wreck
summary: Since his disastrous televised debate with Donald Trump, the president of the United States has ignored calls to drop his bid for a second term. Le Monde looks back at the weeks that saw him and his campaign team shunt any mention of his physical and mental state.

title: Socialists refuse to endorse former communist MP Huguette Bello as prime minister
summary: The president of the regional council of La Réunion has received the backing of the Communists and hard-left LFI leader Jean-Luc Mélenchon. The Socialists put forward several arguments against Bello, such as the fact that she did not take part in the vote on the law on same-sex marriage in 2013.

title: Israel claims to have targeted Hamas military chief Mohammed Deif in Gaza
summary: The Israeli army was unable to determine on Saturday whether the mastermind of the October 7 attack had been hit. The bombings, carried out in the heart of a 'safe zone,' left 71 people dead, according to Gazan health officials.

title: Jegou-Auradou case: the background to the indictment of the rugby players accused of "aggravated rape" in Argentina
summary: The two French national team players remain in pre-trial detention in Mendoza, where they have chosen not to make any statement. They are still proclaiming their innocence in a case where two versions of the story contradict each other.

title: Russia hit by gigantic forest fires amid official indifference
summary: In Siberia and the Russian Far East, a million hectares of forest are being ravaged by flames. Since the beginning of the year, fires have destroyed an area the size of Normandy. Regulations and public management are being questioned.

title: Hamas-run health ministry says 90 killed in Israeli strike on displacement camp
summary: The airstrike in Khan Yunis on Saturday targeted the mastermind of the October 7 attack Mohammed Deif, according to the Israeli military. Gaza's Hamas-run health ministry said 90 Palestinians were killed in the strike, which Israel did not confirm.

title: 'Stop the bickering': Bernie Sanders voices support for Biden's candidacy
summary: 'Enough! Mr Biden may not be the ideal candidate, but he will be the candidate and should be the candidate," the independent senator wrote in a 'New York Times' column.

title: Tour de France: Pogacar extends lead with Pyrénées win
summary: Tadej Pogacar won his second stage of this year's edition, and now has a lead of 1 min 57 sec over Jonas Vingegaard.

title: Pioneering video artist Bill Viola dies aged 73
summary: The American artist was known for creating powerful video installations often dealing with the extremes of human emotion and experience of birth, death and consciousness. Over five decades, Viola's work reached a global audience.

title: French PM Attal elected head of Macron's Renaissance group in Parliament
summary: The outgoing prime minister will lead lawmakers from President Emmanuel Macron's party in the Assemblée Nationale.

title: Paris Olympics: French sports minister swims in Seine river
summary: Sports Minister Amélie Oudéa-Castéra took a dip in Paris' Seine river on Saturday, two weeks before the start of the Games.

title: Tennis: Barbora Krejcikova wins Wimbledon women's title
summary: The Czech player beat Italy's Jasmine Paolini 6-2, 2-6, 6-4 to win her second Grand Slam singles title.

title: Ambani wedding: 'In India, the pomp of CEOs has replaced that of kings'
summary: Philippe Escande, Le Monde columnist, writes that the Indian billionaire Anant Ambani's extravagant star-studded wedding is a reflection of India today, one in which the upper caste are those who are the friends of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Defense: Competition between tank manufacturers rekindled by war in Ukraine
summary: The Russian-Ukrainian conflict has made the heavy tank a major weapon once again. The European market is dominated by Germany's Rheinmetall and KNDS but also by American and South Korean manufacturers.

title: Out-of-office messages are always a bad idea
summary: Avoid using an automatic email reply that lets everyone know you've taken off.

title: Israeli army acknowledges failures in village during October 7 attack
summary: The Israeli army acknowledged its security failures in defending the Beeri kibbutz, where more than a hundred people were killed in the Hamas attack, in its first internal investigation into its conduct on October 7.

title: As French left looks for a prime minister, an unexpected name emerges
summary: Huguette Bello, the president of the regional council of La Réunion, an overseas territory in the Indian Ocean, has received the backing of the Communists, the Greens and Jean-Luc Mélenchon. But the Socialists still want their leader to be the left's candidate to form a government.

title: Arizona Democrats worry about Biden: 'We need to form a kind of phalanx around him'
summary: The US president's health is worrying party members in this key state for the November presidential election.

title: After euphoria, fear of bubble grows around generative AI
summary: Some analysts are warning that spending in the generative artificial intelligence sector, particularly on computing capacity, is far outstripping revenues.

title: China has won the solar panel competition
summary: This is a strategic sector for Beijing, in a country that has mastered the value chain and lef the West behind.

title: E-pimps: On OnlyFans, young men chase fortunes by becoming 'managers'
summary: On social media, young 'entrepreneurs' encourage peers to get rich by managing the careers of female content creators on erotic platforms. Seemingly thriving, the 'business' primarily relies on a pyramid scheme of overpriced training programs with misogynistic undertones.

title: Meet the far-right French MPs elected despite racist, anti-abortion or climate-skeptic stances
summary: Twenty-one new or returning MPs who have taken radical positions will serve in the Assemblée Nationale for Marine Le Pen's Rassemblement National party.

summary: The Olympic torch relay will cross the capital on July 14 and 15. View its route on our map.

title: Polish MPs reject decriminalization of abortion assistance
summary: The penal code will continue to enforce up to three years in prison for anyone helping a woman to have an abortion after a proposed law was rejected by a margin of just three votes.

title: Donald Trump escapes assassination attempt, Republicans blame Democratic 'rhetoric'
summary: The former president, whose ear was hit, is safe after a gunman opened fire at his rally in Pennsylvania on Saturday, killing one spectator and wounding two others.

title: Trump assassination attempt: What we know about how it unfolded and the shooter
summary: The FBI identified the shooter as Thomas Matthew Crooks, a 20-year-old from Pennsylvania's Bethel Park.

title: The Paris 2024 Olympics and the promises of a new Seine
summary: Massive investments have been made to restore the river that flows through Paris to its former glory and functions, both in preparation for the Olympic and Paralympic Games and to comply with the European Water Framework Directive adopted in 2000.

title: Hamas says it will pull out of Gaza truce talks after Israeli strike targeting Deif
summary: Israel said it targeted Hamas’ military commander in a massive strike Saturday in the crowded southern Gaza Strip that killed at least 92 Palestinians, according to local health officials.

title: France's Olympic flagbearer Mélina Robert-Michon: 'It's been a real struggle to show that you can be a discus thrower and a woman'
summary: 'I wouldn't have got here if...' Every week, Le Monde interviews a famous figure about a decisive moment in their life. Olympic medal-winning discus thrower Mélina Robert-Michon found a way to tame her body in her sport.

title: French left back to square one as proposed PM 'declines' role
summary: Huguette Bello, who was backed by the Communists and La France Insoumise, crucially did not have the support of the Socialists.

title: Lamine Yamal, the 17-year-old new symbol of Spain
summary: The young winger embodies the revival of the Spanish national team, which is aiming for a fourth continental success against England in Sunday's Euro 2024 final.

title: François Hollande and his actress wife were at a café. Does anyone care?
summary: After a trip to the polling booth on July 7, former president François Hollande and his wife Julie Gayet enjoyed their Sunday in downtown Tulle, Corrèze – waiting for victory and looking in the same direction together.

summary: The professional riders union CPA said it intends to sue the spectator.

summary: The torchbearers began a two-day tour of famed monuments across the French capital, less than two weeks ahead of the start of the Games.
